item.title: 'Hello World' with micro:bit v2
item.description: Now that you’ve installed the micro:bit v2 development environment, we can get started on programming a simple micro:bit project. First of all, we should initialise a blank project in a new directory. Let’s call it ‘microbit-first-project’. This guide assumes the use of micro-tools to manage building and initialising projects outside of the samples directory. If you are not using micro-tools, simply create your project files from within the microbit-v2-samples/source folder.
